addChainIDsToWhitelist(uint256[],address.details: msg.sender must be the owner of the CrossChainRegistry

params.chainIDs: the chainIDs to add to the whitelist
params.operatorTableUpdaters: the operatorTableUpdaters for each whitelisted chainID

calculateOperatorTableBytes((address,uin.details: This function aggregates data from multiple sources for cross-chain transport

params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to calculate the operator table for

returns._0: the encoded operatorTableBytes containing:         - operatorSet details         - curve type from KeyRegistrar         - operator set configuration         - calculated operator table from the calculator contract

constructor.details: Initializes the CrossChainRegistry with immutable dependencies

params._allocationManager: The allocation manager for operator set validation
params._keyRegistrar: The key registrar for operator set curve type validation
params._pauserRegistry: The pauser registry for pause functionality
params._permissionController: The permission controller for access control
params._version: The semantic version of the contract

createGenerationReservation((address,uin.details: msg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsOnce a generation reservation is created, the operator table will be transported to all chains that are whitelisted

params.config: the config to set for the operatorSet
params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to make a reservation for

returns._0: An array of operatorSets with active generationReservations

params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to get the operatorSetConfig for

returns._0: The operatorSetConfig for the given operatorSet

params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to get the operatorTableCalculator for

returns._0: The operatorTableCalculator for the given operatorSet
An array of chainIDs that are supported by the CrossChainRegistry
returns._1: An array of operatorTableUpdaters corresponding to each chainID

getTableUpdateCadence().details: The table update cadence is applicable to all chains

params.initialOwner: The initial owner of the contract

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause(uint256).details: This function can only pause functionality, and thus cannot 'unflip' any bit in `_paused` from 1 to 0.

params.newPausedStatus: represents the new value for `_paused` to take, which means it may flip several bits at once.

removeChainIDsFromWhitelist(uint256[]).details: msg.sender must be the owner of the CrossChainRegistry

params.chainIDs: the chainIDs to remove from the whitelist

removeGenerationReservation((address,uin.details: msg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avs

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32),(a.details: msg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsoperatorSet must have an active generation reservationThe max staleness period is NOT checkpointed and is applied globally regardless of the reference timestamp of a certificate

params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to set the operatorSetConfig for

setOperatorTableCalculator((address,uint.details: msg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsoperatorSet must have an active reservation

params.operatorSet: the operatorSet whose operatorTableCalculator is desired to be set
params.operatorTableCalculator: the contract to call to calculate the operator table

setTableUpdateCadence(uint32).details: msg.sender must be the owner of the CrossChainRegistryThe table update cadence cannot be 0

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause(uint256).details: This function can only unpause functionality, and thus cannot 'flip' any bit in `_paused` from 0 to 1.

params.newPausedStatus: represents the new value for `_paused` to take, which means it may flip several bits at once.

returns._0: The version string in SemVer format (e.g., "1.1.1")

addChainIDsToWhitelist(uint256[],address.notice: Adds chainIDs to the whitelist of chainIDs that are transported to by the multichain protocol

calculateOperatorTableBytes((address,uin.notice: Calculates the operatorTableBytes for a given operatorSet

getOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32)).notice: Gets the operatorSetConfig for a given operatorSet

getOperatorTableCalculator((address,uint.notice: Gets the operatorTableCalculator for a given operatorSet

getSupportedChains().notice: Gets the list of chains that are supported by the CrossChainRegistry

initialize(address,uint32,uint256).notice: Initializes the contract with the initial paused status and owner

pause(uint256).notice: This function is used to pause an EigenLayer contract's functionality. It is permissioned to the `pauser` address, which is expected to be a low threshold multisig.

paused().notice: Returns the current paused status as a uint256.

paused(uint8).notice: Returns 'true' if the `indexed`th bit of `_paused` is 1, and 'false' otherwise

pauserRegistry().notice: Address of the `PauserRegistry` contract that this contract defers to for determining access control (for pausing).

permissionController().notice: Pointer to the permission controller contract.

removeChainIDsFromWhitelist(uint256[]).notice: Removes chainIDs from the whitelist of chainIDs

removeGenerationReservation((address,uin.notice: Removes a generation reservation for a given operatorSet

setOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32),(a.notice: Sets the operatorSetConfig for a given operatorSet

setOperatorTableCalculator((address,uint.notice: Sets the operatorTableCalculator for the operatorSet

setTableUpdateCadence(uint32).notice: Sets the table update cadence in seconds

unpause(uint256).notice: This function is used to unpause an EigenLayer contract's functionality. It is permissioned to the `unpauser` address, which is expected to be a high threshold multisig or governance contract.

version().notice: Returns the semantic version string of the contract.
